intro: Pleomele cantleyi, commonly known as the Kauai pleomele, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Hawaiian island of Kauai. It belongs to the Agavaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming foliage composed of thick, fleshy leaves. The plant produces striking inflorescences with clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in native forest understories. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
